name: All of Us Python and Cloud Storage snippets

sub-menu.name: (1) Setup
sub-menu.snippet:
import os
import subprocess
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

sub-menu.name: list_objects_in_bucket.py
sub-menu.snippet:
# This snippet assumes that you run setup first

# This code lists objects in your Google Bucket

# Get the bucket name
my_bucket = os.getenv('WORKSPACE_BUCKET')

# List objects in the bucket
print(subprocess.check_output(f"gsutil ls -r {my_bucket}", shell=True).decode('utf-8'))

sub-menu.name: (3) Copy file to or from Workspace Bucket
copy_data_to_workspace_bucket.py
sub-menu.snippet:
# This snippet assumes you run setup first

# This code saves your dataframe into a csv file in a "data" folder in Google Bucket

# Replace df with THE NAME OF YOUR DATAFRAME
my_dataframe = df   

# Replace 'test.csv' with THE NAME of the file you're going to store in the bucket (don't delete the quotation marks)
destination_filename = 'test.csv'

########################################################################
##
################# DON'T CHANGE FROM HERE ###############################
##
########################################################################

# save dataframe in a csv file in the same workspace as the notebook
my_dataframe.to_csv(destination_filename, index=False)

# get the bucket name
my_bucket = os.getenv('WORKSPACE_BUCKET')

# copy csv file to the bucket
os.system(f"gsutil cp './{destination_filename}' '{my_bucket}/data/'")
print(f'[INFO] {destination_filename} is successfully uploaded in your bucket.')

sub-menu.name: copy_file_from_workspace_bucket.py
sub-menu.snippet:
# This snippet assumes you run setup first

# This code copies file in your Google Bucket and loads it into a dataframe

# Replace 'test.csv' with THE NAME of the file you're going to download from the bucket (don't delete the quotation marks)
name_of_file_in_bucket = 'test.csv'

########################################################################
##
################# DON'T CHANGE FROM HERE ###############################
##
########################################################################

# get the bucket name
my_bucket = os.getenv('WORKSPACE_BUCKET')

# copy csv file from the bucket to the current working space
os.system(f"gsutil cp '{my_bucket}/data/{name_of_file_in_bucket}' .")

print(f'[INFO] {name_of_file_in_bucket} is successfully downloaded into your working space')
# save dataframe in a csv file in the same workspace as the notebook
my_dataframe = pd.read_csv(name_of_file_in_bucket)
my_dataframe.head()

sub-menu.name: (4) Interact with HTML snapshots in the Workspace Bucket
interact_with_html_snapshots.py
sub-menu.snippet:
from terra_widgets.html_snapshots import display_html_snapshots_widget

# This will display a user interface to interact with HTML snapshots stored in the workspace bucket.
display_html_snapshots_widget()
